title: Simplify Funeral Planning With This Rough Draft
text:
New tool from FuneralBuyer.com allows you to record the information needed at the time of death and make the most important decisions regarding funerals, cremation, and burial.
Sterling, Virginia (PRWEB) September 30, 2015
FuneralBuyer.com has developed a new, complimentary tool for those who want to write down their funeral plans, and potentially save thousands of dollars in the process.
When someone dies, survivors often have a big job ahead of them, making decisions, and trying to pull together all of the required information for the death certificate, funeral provider, and insurance companies. Sometimes, the tress and emotional turmoil put those who have to make the funeral arrangements in a poor bargaining position.
Funeral tend to be very expensive, and decisions about spending large sums of money often must be made in less time than the typical family might devote to deciding which movie to go see.
Now, those who want to get their affairs in order in advance, as well as those who are faced with an imminent death or who have just experienced the death of someone close, have a way to get all of the data, decisions, and plans in one place before they ever have to talk to a funeral home or crematory.
Called “My Funeral Rough Draft: Personal Data and Final Arrangements Form,” the document is simple, self-explanatory, and comprehensive regarding the information and decisions typically required at the time of death. It can be found online at FuneralBuyer.com.
The “Rough Draft” covers information required for the death certificate as well as for obituaries, people to contact, location of important documents, and other personal biographical information.
The "Rough Draft" also provides a framework for deciding on ceremonies and disposition of the body; decisions that could make a difference of many thousands of dollars in funeral or cremation expense.
For your copy of the “Funeral Rough Draft,” visit FuneralBuyer.com.
